column4: hey, I want to set up some permanent aliases on my newly installed ubuntu, how do I do it?
/etc/bash.bashrc iirc
what
currently the prompt that I get in the terminal is: <username>@<computername>
you want to change it permanently?
edit the PS1 variable in /etc/profile
where can I find out what the format is?
google bash prompt, there a bunch of escape sequences you can use to define stuff
scp
it has been put into the filesystem
it is no longer just an inaccessible device file but its contents have been inserted into the filesystem for viewing
paste that script
I just told you to paste the script
paste the goddamn script for the love of god
paste what script??
/media/cdrom0/install, what else
/media/cdrom0/install -t, try that although that doesn't explain your error message
run it with -t
have you run it with -t yet?
yes, I just get the same stuff only in the terminal
which is
I got the installer to run...
not $awk, $ awk
as in $ being the dollar sign in your terminal
